intro: Micromeles subulata, commonly known as the slender leafed micromeles, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and delicate, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
